blog.name: bisexualgendryas
blog.title: we all got crowns
blog.description:
charley. in my 20s. they/them.

bisexual. nonbinary. vegan.
activist. spoonie. survivor.

writer. fan. hufflepuff. swiftie.
stark sisters stan. house stark loyalist.

house stark deserved better than GoT.

strength: can start fire by friction.
weakness: can't like things casually.

most recently was teamhousestark.
on tumblr since '08.

multishipper, but mainly
gendrya, femslash, and slash.

credits: sidebar + icon.

summary: Did the show (or books) state that Bran can actually see the future? I know he's had visions with some moments that were from...
body: Did the show (or books) state that Bran can actually see the future? I know he’s had visions with some moments that were from the future, but I don’t recall it being stated that he could literally know what was going to happen, only that he had someone of an ability to predict things based on being able to find basically the entirety of human history

summary:
ㅤ       modern!au for starknight.   “ your family won't like it,”  Night frowns, grabbing boy's hands.  ㅤ

“

 and I don’t ask...
caption:
ㅤ
      modern!au for starknight.

  “ your family won’t like it,”  Night frowns, grabbing boy’s hands.

ㅤ “ and I don’t ask them, ”  the guy whispers, grinning, covering the man’s lips with his own.

✦ Brandon is one of the youngest sons of an influential family of Starks. A diligent student of a prestigious college, and the last hope for a bright future for his father’s business.

✦ Night is a barista at a local coffee shop, which Bran often visits after college.

tags: hodor was the only good thing
i could have skipped ahead so much!!
summary: You know through all these seasons, I'm not gonna lie, I found Bran as a character and his storyline really fucking boring. I...
body:
You know through all these seasons, I’m not gonna lie, I found Bran as a character and his storyline really fucking boring. I was bored out of my mind watching him just being dragged around in snow, and some old dude spouting some nonsense about birds with eyes. BUT I didn’t skip them cause I always thought “ok this seems like unrelated boring yammering now but it will clearly have an important meaning later so I will need to pay attention.”

And then. It didn’t. Fucking. Matter. At. All.

Apart from Hodor’s story none of Bran’s three eyed adventures made any difference in the end!! And I am pissed!!!

tags: he's gonna rule the north and he will be amazing at it
summary: "When he got out from under it and scrambled up near the sky, Bran could see all of Winterfell in a glance. He liked the way it...
body:
“When he got out from under it and scrambled up near the sky, Bran could see all of Winterfell in a glance. He liked the way it looked, spread out beneath him, only birds wheeling over his head while all the life of the castle went on below. Bran could perch for hours among the shapeless, rain-worn gargoyles that brooded over the First Keep, watching it all: the men drilling with wood and steel in the yard, the cooks tending their vegetables in the glass garden, restless dogs running back and forth in the kennels, the silence of the godswood, the girls gossiping beside the washing well. It made him feel like he was lord of the castle, in a way even Robb would never know.”

Bran Stark AGoT

summary: Tyrion Lannister: I know you don't want it. I know you don't care about power. But I ask you now, if we choose you, will you...
caption: Tyrion Lannister: I know you don’t want it. I know you don’t care about power. But I ask you now, if we choose you, will you wear the crown? Will you lead the Seven Kingdoms to the best of your abilities from this day until your last day?Bran Stark: Why do you think I came all this way?

Will you lead the Seven Kingdoms to the best of your abilities from this day until your last day?Bran Stark: Why do you think I came all this way?

body:
Southron Ambitions


It just occured to me that with the ending of GOT, we had Stark/Tully heirs, a Tully lord, a Arryn lord and a Baratheon lord in the great council, making important decisions for Westeros.

Most importantly, there were no Targaryen in sight.

If the Southron Ambitions theory is legit,then this is the closest we got to its fulfillment.

Steffon Baratheon, Rickard Stark, Hoster Tully must be proud of their descendants for unintentionally carrying on their secret plan.

summary: Game of Thrones: A Final Perspective
title: Game of Thrones: A Final Perspective
body:
Game of Thrones: A Final Perspective

***WARNING! THIS POST CONTAINS SPOILERS FOR SEASONS 1-8 OF GAME OF THRONES AND THE ASOIAF BOOKS!***

I’ve defended some of Game of Thrones‘s more questionable or controversial decisions, or, at the very least, accepted them, even if I didn’t always understand them. Literature and television are different mediums, and translating one to the other is not always seamless. I appreciate the hard work…

View On WordPress

summary: I wonder if the writers of game of thrones just made the part with bran becoming king up  cause they didn't set up the...
body:
I wonder if the writers of game of thrones just made the part with bran becoming king up cause they didn’t set up the charecters who rise to power in the books and just realized that they had to come up with an endgame for the rest of the fucking country.

The only way I can see a disabled boy , who has been presumed dead for years, belongs to a minority faith in an age of religious conflict , has no military or leadership experience and has no blood claim to the throne winning a great council style election is litterally dark magic. And even then that that is way beyond anything that is set up in the books. Like even human warging like the shit euron and bran are probably both doing involves the subject being aware of what has happened . Bran winning requires the Lord’s of he south to spontaneously perform a mental 180 on anti northern bias and ableism. I think they pulled bran for king out of thier asses cause they cut all the other charecters who could feasibly win a great council election and or didn’t sent up the independence movements.

If it came down to a great council in the books to elect a new king , which could be interesting if Martin could make it believable, I think it would be between like Eric storm, and some respected people with armies like Mathis Rowan. This is assuming of course that Jon snow has threatened to stab the next person that tries to nominate him.

if he is alive and there is a great council in the books the only reason he won’t be in the runing at least that I can think of is that he will refuse to be in the running because he is tired and fuck the southern lords.

I find it highly unlikely that any group in the books post danys death is gonna have enough military and political capital and motivation to force him to do anything , given the fact most people will have fought to the point of exhaustion unless he is captured by his enemies . And it’s highly unlikely the Lord’s of westeros would vote to have him sent to the wall for killing the woman who murdered his fucking brother and the Lord’s and ladies supporting him and a shit load of smallfolk, like that is a really good excuse for queen slaying and kinslaying pretty much the best excuse possible actually.

summary: I like how they were very detailed over Bran clothes (not as glamour as sansa) and the armor for the knight. He's Three-Eyed...
body:
I like how they were very detailed over Bran clothes (not as glamour as sansa) and the armor for the knight. He’s Three-Eyed Raven now, that’s why the pattern on his clothes is a raven’s feather and a raven as the sigil on the armor.

All hail Bran the Broken, First of His Name, King of the Andals and the First Men, Lord of the Six Kingdoms, and Protector of the Realm.

blog.title: I Could Shave A Spider's Arse If I Wanted To
blog.description: Was beardoftormund. I liked the epilogue, but yeah the writing was awful... Jonmund/Brandrick Discord: w9Hp7KM

summary: Bran lets handmaidens braid his hair because he likes that he can make someone happy with so little.
